title: Free Outdoor Movies: Barbie
description: Free outdoor movie screening of 'Barbie' at Hoyt Playground (Astoria).

title: 114th Annual St. Ann Italian Festival
description: Hoboken's 114th Annual Italian Festival brings zeppole, fried calamari, wood-fired pizza, live music, rides, and more to 7th + Jefferson streets for five days.

title: Hold On to Your Butts
description: Two actors and a foley artist perform a live, shot-for-shot parody of Jurassic Park at Brooklyn Art Haus (Williamsburg).

title: Summer Concerts at Hudson Yards
description: The annual Bowery Presents concert series returns to the public square + gardens at Hudson Yards. Tonight: Trousdale with opener Rett Madison.

title: Summerstage
description: NYC’s iconic summer performing arts festival returns with 85 free and benefit shows in Central Park and 12 neighborhood parks across the five boroughs. Tonight: Arooj Aftab, Sid Sriram, Emel, and DJ Rekha at Rumsey Playfield in Central Park.

title: Jazz at Pier 84
description: The Jazz Foundation of America presents its annual series of outdoor evening concerts at Hell’s Kitchen’s Pier 84. Tonight: Joaquin Pozo y La Clave Suena.

title: Summer Sounds! at Carl Schurz Park
description: Steel Impressions Caribbean Band closes out this year’s Summer Sounds! concert series, held at the elevated John Finley Walk (Yorkville).
address: John Finley Walk, Carl Schurz Park

title: Letters + Sodas: LIC Rooftop Reading Series
description: Writer Lana Schwartz (The New Yorker, The Onion, McSweeney’s) brings together standup, essays, and humor pieces for a new rooftop reading series at Long Island City’s The Greats of Craft. Featuring Alise Morales (Seth Meyers), Brandon Follick (Reductress), Chandler Dean (The New Yorker), Charu Sinha (Vulture), and others.
address: The Greats of Craft, Long Island City

title: We Have Fun: A Stand-Up Show
description: Hosts Zach Sims and Dan Wilbur bring the fun-ny to Young Ethel’s (Park Slope), with stand-up by Adam Conover (Adam Ruins Everything), Isabel Hagen (Fallon), Hari Kondabolu (Netflix), and Bryant Denton (NPR).

title: Garden State 20th Anniversary Concert
description: Don’t panic, just let go as folk band Youth in a Roman Field pays tribute to the soundtrack of Zach Braff’s Garden State.

title: Hanna Dickinson Presents: Goofy C*nt Nation
description: Comedian and writer Hanna Dickinson (Comedy Central) hosts 'A Night of Goofy Jokes from a Goofy Gal and Her Friends' at Union Hall (Park Slope). Featuring Isabel Hagen (Fallon), Natasha Vaynblat (Comedy Central), and Julio Diaz (Netflix is a Joke).

title: Summer Sounds at Manhattan West
description: Manhattan West (Midtown West at 385 9th Avenue) hosts a free series of weekly performances by musicians from around the globe. Today: Luca Mundaca – combining elements of jazz and bossa nova, this Brazilian singer-songwriter weaves together songs of longing, love, Brazil’s vibrant essence, and the human experience.

title: Third Annual Lincoln Center's Summer for the City
description: Lincoln Center hosts 200+ free or choose-what-you-pay concerts, dance parties, performances, films screenings, and more through August. This week: Festival Orchestra of Lincoln Center: Beethoven's Pastoral and a Huang Ruo premiere (Tues + Weds 7:30pm), Danny Lipsitz and the Brass Tracks Ballroom Orchestra (Weds 6:30pm), Stud Country Social Dance Party (Thurs 6:30pm), Shallow Alcove (Thurs 7:30pm), and more.

title: Collage Party
description: Get crafty at Tiny Arts Supply Store’s collage party at The Windjammer (Ridgewood). Supplies included, but also bring items to use/share.

title: Live at the Gantries
description: Kupferberg Center for the Arts presents Live at the Gantries, an annual outdoor concert series at Gantry Plaza State Park. Tonight: Super Yamba Band (Afro-beat and Afro-funk).

title: Drop In: Comedy
description: Mia Jackson and Isabel Hagen present a comedy show at Two Boots Pizza in Park Slope, with standup by Jamie Shriner (The Onion), Hari Kondabolu (Netflix), Alex Babbitt (HBO) and April Brody (VH1). Bonus: Free beer 7:30-8pm (one/person), and raffles for free pizza.

title: Naumburg Orchestral Concerts
description: Outdoor orchestral concerts return to Central Park's historic Naumburg Bandshell for a 119th season. Tonight: The Handel + Haydn Society will perform works by Handel, Bach, and Corelli. Hosted by WQXR’s Terrance McKnight. All concerts will be broadcast live.

title: Live Band Karaoke at Arlene's Grocery
description: Choose from over 175 rock and pop songs and sing with your very own live band backing you up at Arlene's Grocery (LES). Led by Leslie Goshko, and featuring Lucas Shine, Matthew Lindsey, and Alan Camlet.

title: Hyperfocus: A Neurodivergent Comedy Show
description: Host Virginia Dickens (The Onion, Reductress) and a lineup of neurodivergent comedians share the wealth of their super-niche knowledge at the Hyperfocus show. Featuring Kate Sisk (Comedy Central), Elissa Bassist (The New York Times), Eddie Dougrou, and Carrie Ross.
